channel.title: Dragon Talk - An Official Dungeons & Dragons Podcast
channel.description: Go inside the walls of Dungeons & Dragons for exclusive interviews and previews! The D&D team sits down each week with celebrities and personalities from across gaming and pop culture to discuss one of the greatest fantasy brands of all-time. We'll talk about the tabletop roleplaying game, as the latest in D&D video games, comics, novels, movies, and television, plus listen to our live play-throughs featuring Penny-Arcade's Acquisitions Incorporated.
channel.itunes:summary: Go inside the walls of Dungeons & Dragons for exclusive interviews and previews! The D&D team sits down each week with celebrities and personalities from across gaming and pop culture to discuss one of the greatest fantasy brands of all-time. We'll talk about the tabletop roleplaying game, as the latest in D&D video games, comics, novels, movies, and television, plus listen to our live play-throughs featuring Penny-Arcade's Acquisitions Incorporated.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Official Dungeons & Dragons Podcast.
channel.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
channel.itunes:keywords: Dungeons & Dragons, tabletop games, video games, interviews, play, D&D, celebrities, Acquisition Inc, Acquisitions Incorporated, fantasy

item.title: Victoria Rogers and Josh Perault on Podcasts of Waterdeep
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Waterdeep: Dragon Heist is coming to game stores on Sept. 7 and to celebrate we have Victoria Rogers & Josh Perault on to discuss Podcasts of Waterdeep, ten episodes of a continuous story recorded by artist from the D&D liveplay community. Victoria, DM of the Broadswords, and Josh, from the Taking Initiative podcast, teamed up to outline this storyline you will be able to download from the Dungeon Delve RSS starting on September 10. Learn about Podcast of Waterdeep at dnd.wizards.com/powd. On Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins tells everyone about some of the more obscure named wizards in the Forgotten Realms.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00: Intro with Greg Tito & Shelly Mazzanoble 09:05: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 22:35: Interview with Victoria Rogers & Josh Perault 1:11:05: Outro with Greg Tito & Shelly Mazzanoble

item.title: Stoic (Banner Saga Devs) on D&D and Digital Games
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Speaking with the folks behind digital games who are inspired by D&D is always such a joy and Arnie Jorgensen and Alex Thomas from Stoic Studio were no different. Alex and Arnie have just shipped their latest installment of The Banner Saga, finishing up a trilogy of tactical storytelling RPGs set in a world inspired by the Norse. Shelly Mazzanoble was not around for this interview, sadly, but she and Greg Tito introduce this segments with usual banter and musical performances. In LYSK, Chris Perkins details some of the fun named wizards in the Forgotten Realms you can use as inspiration in your games!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00: Intro with Greg Tito 10:10: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 24:05: Interview with Stoic 1:16:10: Outro with just Greg Tito

item.title: Surena Marie and Brandon Stennis on Rivals of Waterdeep
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
It's the triumphant return of Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) to Dragon Talk! She returns to help Greg Tito (@gregtito) introduce the interview he did with Surena Marie and Brandon Stennis, two of the cast-members from Rivals of Waterdeep. They discuss what it was like at the Stream of Many Eyes, how the group formed, and playing D&D for the first time. Lore You Should Know: Chris Perkins explains all about the Bregan D'aerthe, a faction of drow led by Jarlaxle Baenre.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00: Intro with Greg Tito 17:55: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 41:00: Interview with Surena Marie & Brandon Stennis 1:24:35: Outro with just Greg Tito

item.title: Benjamin Loomes and Jenny Bendel of Syrinscape
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Syrinscape is an awesome tool for Dungeon Masters to add sound effects and music to their game with a simple-to-use interface. Benjamin Loomes and Jenny Bendel stop by the office to record some voices for the Waterdeep: Dragon Heist sound pack coming to Syrinscape on September 7, and we pulled them into our studio to talk about developing Syrinscape, being a Wizards employee back in the day, and opera singing. In Lore You Should Know: Where do mind flayers come from? Chris Perkins lets us all know!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00: Intro with Greg Tito 09:25: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 28:35: Interview with Syrinscape 1:11:00: Outro with just Greg Tito

item.title: Alex Kammer on Gamehole Con
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Alex Kammer is a longtime D&D fan and collector, and he also just happens to be the founder of GameholeCon, co-owner of True Dungeon and an incredibly nice person. He called in to speak to Shelly and Greg about their recent trip to Origins Game Fair, what the Game Hole actually is, and Alex's collection of all TSR products in the original shrink wrap. WHAT? In an extended segment of Sage Advice, Jeremy Crawford (managing editor and lead rules designer for D&D) takes a slew of user-submitted questions and answers with his own personal flair.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00: Intro with Greg Tito 11:19: Sage Advice with Jeremy Crawford 1:15:15: Interview with Alex Kammer 2:02:46: Outro with just Greg Tito

item.title: Keith Baker, Jeremy Crawford & James Wyatt on Ravnica & Eberron
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Big announcement day on Dragon Talk with three fantastic guests! Keith Baker (creator of Eberron and lead designer on Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron), James Wyatt (lead designer on Guildmasters' Guide to Ravnica), and Jeremy Crawford (managing editor and lead rules designer for D&D) join hosts Shelly and Greg to talk about these two awesome new products both set in fantastical urban environments. In a triumphant return to Sage Advice, Jeremy Crawford talks about how all these worlds and settings fit into the D&D cosmology.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 15:40: Sage Advice with Jeremy Crawford 1:02:20: Interview with Keith Baker and James Wyatt 01:48:10: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Kade Wells and Sarah Roman on Teaching with D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Kade Wells returns to the podcast after nearly 3(!) years with fellow educator Sarah Roman to talk about how teachers can start to use Dungeons & Dragons in the classroom. Find out more at teachingwithdnd.com. In LYSK, Chris Perkins discusses Skullport, the city below the city of Waterdeep.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 09:30: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 30:30: Interview with Kade Wells and Sarah Roman 01:23:35: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Trent Oster & Eric Jordan on D&D Video Games
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Trent Oster from Beamdog and Eric Jordan from Codename Entertainment call in to talk about the Stream of Many Eyes, the awesome costumes on display there, and Deekin from Neverwinter Nights: Enhanced Edition joining the ranks of heroes available in Idle Champions of the Forgotten Realms. Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito are crazy but nothing has really changed on that front.
In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins goes into detail about how smokepowder works in the Forgotten Realms.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 10:25: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 24:50: Interview with Trent Oster and Eric Jordan 01:15:10: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Dr. Megan Connell on D&D Helping People
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Professional psychologist and gamer Dr. Megan Connell (@MeganPsyD) spoke to Shelly and Greg back in April about what it's like to run D&D for young people and the benefits of roleplaying games for players with social challenges.
Your hosts can barely hold it together before introducing Lore You Should Know w/ Chris Perkins on Born Again Monsters in D&D, who just keep coming back despite how much damage you deal.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 12:25: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 30:00: Interview with Dr. Megan Connell 01:19:50: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Matt Baume and Hidden Lore
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito talk to Matt Baume, the DM for Queens of Adventure. Matt talks about the similarities between drag culture and D&D, what it was like to perform his first DMing session live in front of 100 people, and what's coming next for the Queens.
In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins discusses all the hidden lore in the core rulebooks for D&D fifth edition you may not have found yet.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 11:45: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 25:10: Interview with Matt Baume 01:15:25: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Of Maps and Planar Contracts
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) go a little crazy talking to Wolfgang Baur and Anna B. Meyer all about the maps she creates for Kobold Press and the D&D setting of Greyhawk. Super fascinating stuff! We love maps! Heads-up: This interview was recording back in April but it's TIMELESS.
In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins discusses what happens with contracts made by and between planar beings.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 07:12: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 29:35: Interview with Wolfgang Baur and Anna B. Meyer 01:09:40: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Off the Table at the Stream of Many Eyes
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (#notreplaced, @shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) talk about what happened at the Stream of Many Eyes, Origins Games Fair, and on Monday when Shelly couldn't make it to work. In this episode's interview, Greg speaks to Elisa Teague (@geekypinup) and Ivan Van Norman (@Hydra_Lord) about writing the off-the-table sessions of D&D shown at the Stream of Many Eyes. Learn about how we put together the three sessions of heightened D&D in which the players and NPCs were all in costume interacting with the Dungeon Master as portrayed by Ivan Van Norman.
In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins (@chrisperkinsdnd) goes over what the marut are all about – planar beings from Mechanus who enforce all contracts and agreements. Watch out #WaffleCrew!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 09:49: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins – Marut! 26:59: Interview with Ivan Van Norman and Elisa Teague 01:23:49: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Emmet and Elisa on #NoStoneUnturned ARG
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
After a week-long hiatus during the Stream of Many Eyes, our hosts return triumphantly to regale us with remarkable tales from the city of Waterdeep. Well, Greg Tito does; Shelly Mazzanoble didn't get to go. But, no matter. Shelly will soon be at Origins Game Fair, which is happening this June 13-17 in Columbus, OH and she'll have a real WW2 era tank! For the interview, writer and transmedia producer Emmett Furey and physical adventure game designer Elisa Teague are on to reveal all that went into the captivating #NoStoneUnturned ARG (Alternate Reality Game) that they ran in the lead-up to the Stream of Many Eyes event.
Then in Lore You Should Know: In the world of Dungeons & Dragons few, perhaps no other, commands as much veneration and at times even terror as the archmage of Greyhawk himself, Mordenkainen. Chris Perkins delves into the long history, both real and imagined, of this character that Gary Gygax himself embodied, when he wanted to adventure in the world of his own creation.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00: Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito 19:03: Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins 39:13: Interview with Emmett Furey and Elisa Teague 1:24:44: Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Krystina Arielle Tigner on Stream of Many Eyes
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
We have reached Stream of Many Eyes eve everyone! In just a scant few hours, the show will commence! With a plethora of amazing Dungeons & Dragons live-play, detailed sets, cosplay, and exciting announcements, all streamed live on Twitch.tv/dnd, this will really be something you won't want to miss! On today's podcast, Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) welcome Sirens of the Realms star Krystina Arielle Tigner. A fairly new player in the D&D universe, Krystina only started playing a few years ago. Yet, in that time she has already had many exciting adventures both in table-top gaming and in real life. She calls in to tell us all about it. Lore You Should Know— The Elemental Planes of the multiverse harbor fantastical beings of immense power and innumerable mortal dangers. The formidable Genies however, travel easily between these worlds and when they venture to the Material Plane they sometimes have children. These offspring are known as the Genasi and they are the topic of discussion today with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD).
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 10:48 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 21:26 – Interview with Krystina Arielle Tigner (@KrystinaArielle) 1:05:13 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Mark Hulmes & Matthew Lillard on Stream of Many Eyes
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Our resident royals of the Dragon Talk domain, Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito), are joined today by veteran actor Matthew Lillard (@matthewLillard) and professional Dungeon Master extraordinaire, Mark Hulmes (@sherlockHulmes). On Sunday (June 3, 10am- 1pm PT) Matthew will be participating in a live-play D&D game along with Taliesin Jaffe, Sam Riegel, and Ashley Johnson from Critical Role! Mark will DM this exciting adventure streamed live for the Stream of Many Eyes (#SoME)! Tickets to be right there in the audience are still available for purchase or you can tune-in to the livestream at Twitch.tv/dnd on June 1st- 3rd to watch all the action. Lore You Should Know—Eons ago, the incredibly powerful arcanists of Netheril ruled over a vast dominion of astonishing floating cities and seemingly limitless magic. But, a great cataclysm all but obliterated this once magnificent empire. We learn all about this and more on this weeks podcast with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD).
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 17:58 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 27:29 – Interview with Matthew Lillard (@matthewLillard) & Mark Hulmes (@sherlockHulmes) 1:13:45 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Rachel Seeley & Kelly D'Angelo on Girls, Guts, Glory
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Today's episode of Dragon Talk begins with Kelly Lynne D'Angelo (@kahlanrock) and Rachel Seeley (@sunnyseeley) from the popular L.A. based, all-female D&D actual-play podcast: Girls, Guts, Glory (@girlsgutsglory), calling in to talk about how they got started playing and where it has taken them since. Greg Tito (@gregtito) and Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) share some of their early experiences meeting people from many diverse backgrounds through creative gaming and being citizens of the inclusive nerd-verse with Kelly and Rachel. Lore You Should Know— The immortal daughters of the greater goddess, Mystra, The Seven Sisters are detailed in the segment today with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD).

item.title: David Harmon & Shakeera on Dragon Friends
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
We begin with a stream of many exciting announcements to kick-off this week's Dragon Talk with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). The Stream of Many Eyes (#SoMEDnD) is taking place on June 1-3rd! You can even experience this event in person! Buy your tickets (SoME) now to tour the sets, interact with D&D luminaries, get a bag of D&D swag, and sit in the live studio audience to watch your favorite performers roll dice. Live in the studio today, we have a spirited conversation with David Harmon (@daveharmon) and Shakeera Khan (websitesbykhan), from the monthly comedy show and podcast: The Dragon Friends (TheDragonFriends). Pour yourself into this monthly comedy show and podcast where comedians muddle through their first Dungeons & Dragons adventure campaign, occasionally with a stout brew close at hand for when the role-playing action really gets perilous. Lore You Should Know—Halflings and Gnomes are the topic for our weekly delve into D&D lore. Listen as Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) edify the histories, qualities, and aspirations of these diminutive, peaceful folk.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 11:05 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 23:34 – Interview with David Harmon (@daveharmon) & Shakeera Khan (websitesbykhan) 1:14:16 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Nate Sharp & Kaiji Tang on Dark & Dicey
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
The eyes have it! The Stream of Many Eyes (SoME) event has officially been announced! Listen as Greg Tito (@gregtito) and Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) regale us with the exciting details of this 3-Day extravaganza of Twitch streamers, actors, cosplayers, full life-sized sets, and captivating D&D live-play, all in a massive Los Angeles studio!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 11:09 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 35:52 – Interview with Reuben Bresler (@MoxReuby) 1:11:24 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Reuben Bresler on Poker, Magic & Standup
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Comedian and Magic personality, Reuben Bresler (@MoxReuby) is live in the studio today. Reuben is a man of many talents. He has made a living as a professional poker player and has entertained audiences in comedy clubs across the nation as a stand-up comedian. But, his most enduring passion has been in table-top gaming, since he first got the chance to participate in his parents D&D games at 7-years old. Reuben has also held a love of Magic the Gathering for many years and has brought his unique brand of humor to the game community as a long-time MTG personality. Be sure to check-out his weekly podcast, Magic Mics (@magicmics) which features Reuben Bresler, Evan Erwin, and Erin Campell. Lore You Should Know — In this episode, we journey to the far-off land of Cormyr with our lore masters, Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD). Inspired by prolific Arthurian folklore, this is a sweeping land of knights of the realm, powerful barons engaged in political intrigue at court, and mighty clashes between great armies.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 09:07 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett(@Sernett) & Chris Perkins(@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 31:11 – Interview with Nate Sharp (@NateWantsToBtl) & Kaiji Tang (@KaijiTang) 1:19:27 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: B. DAVE WALTERS ON STREAMING D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
We get motivated while the wine flows as hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) kick off another exciting episode of Dragon Talk. Our guest today is writer and motivational speaker B. Dave Walters (@BDaveWalters).
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 09:01 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) & Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 29:02 – Interview with B. Dave Walters (@BDaveWalters) 1:19:40 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Claudio Pozas & Teos Abadia on Latin America Gaming
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito chat with artist Claudio Pozas and writer Teos Abadia today, then on Lore You Should Know we learn all about the gun powder loving Giff from Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 11:35 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) 25:50 – Interview with Claudio Pozas (www.claudiopozas.com) & Teos Abadia (@alphastream) 1:11:11 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Russell Tomas on D&D Through the Ages
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Russell Tomas, CEO and Lead Designer at gaming company Dreamlords Digital, is on for the interview today. For Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett explore the enigmatic Star Spawn.

item.title: Xalavier Nelson On RPG Design
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
We begin today's Golden Geek Award nominated podcast with some important public service announcements from our illustrious hosts, Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) ) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). Don't stand too close to an open staircase and beware the uncut grapes of wrath! After these and other serious matters, we have a chat with Xalavier Nelson Jr. (@WritNelson). Xalavier is a freelance game developer and columnist for PC Gamer magazine. You can play some of his free online adventures such as Screw You, Bear Dad and All Hail the Spider God by browsing to xalaviermakeswords.com. If you enjoy the experience, you can donate by clicking the Support This Game button on the game page. Lore You Should Know – The Raven Queen, the enigmatic deity who shepherds the souls of mortals to the beyond, is the subject of discussion with Matt Sernett (@sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) today.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 17:30 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) – The Raven Queen 38:35 – Xalavier Nelson Jr. (@WritNelson) 1:21:37 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Mario Ortegon On D&D en Espanol
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
UX Designer, gamer, and extraordinary DM/Narrator Mario Ortegon joins our hosts Greg Tito (@gregtito) and Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) to talk about his work on "Una Partida Mas" (One More Game) which brings Dungeons & Dragons to Spanish speaking players and audiences on his Twitch channel at Twitch.tv/elwarius. Mario is originally from Mexico, which is where he first began playing D&D via online forums and text messaging after becoming interested in the game after seeing the Dungeons & Dragons live-action movie. Mario went on to DM his own homebrew campaign, in which he drew inspiration from the rich history of the ancient Maya, Inca, and Aztec cultures. Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins & Matt Sernett are on today to teach us about the long, contentious history of the Gith. Once slaves under the oppression of the Mind Flayer empire, these humanoids rose up behind a great leader named Gith, which is where they take their name from. Through much strife and bloodshed, they finally defeated their tyrannical illithid masters. But, peace did not follow. A rift erupted within the Gith people soon after the war and they split into two groups known as the Githzerai and Githyanki, which have vehemently despised each other ever since.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 13:20 – Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins & Matt Sernett– Gith 33:57 – Mario Ortegon (@elwarius) 1:13:43 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Joe Manganiello on Arkhan & Critical Role
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
We begin by welcoming this week's guest…Bob Ross? Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) let their imaginations soar with the possibilities of Axis & Allies & Bob Rosses! Tremble in fear at the thought of an all-out assault of legions of evil little trees upon your forces! After this flight of fancy, we come back to reality to present our actual interview with actor, director, author, and Emmy Award winning narrator Joe Manganiello (@joemanganiello). From the age of ten, Joe has had a love for tabletop gaming and storytelling. When he got the chance to play as a guest on the massively popular live-stream D&D game, Critical Role, he stole the show in an astounding act of betrayal during the gripping finale of the first campaign. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@jeremyecrawford) explains the sometimes-tricky subject of mounted combat on the podcast today. Riding into battle atop a mighty steed or even soaring through the clouds on the back of a dragon is a mainstay of fantasy narratives, but in D&D there are specific rules and limitations to consider.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 10:29 – Lore You Should Know with Jeremy Crawford (@jeremyecrawford) – Mounted Combat 52:27 – Joe Manganiello (@joemanganiello) 1:15:44 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Adam Bradford on D&D Beyond Mobile
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
As we begin this week's Dragon Talk, our hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) seem to be lost in time again! Using a cellphone just to make…phone calls? Myspace? Friendster!? Thankfully we return to the present just in time to have a conversation with Adam Bradford (@BadEyeAdam) and Todd Kenreck (@ToddKenreck) of Curse.com, the web application developers who created D&D Beyond, the amazing digital companion web app for Dungeons and Dragons. The first order of business is to establish what everyone's cosplay characters should be. Greg Tito in a Viking helm as Balduran from Baldur's Gate, perhaps? Then Adam Bradford reveals the exciting news that the beta for the D&D Beyond app on Android and iPhone platforms is now available as a free download! Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@sernett) & Chris Perkins (@chrisPerkinsDnD) are on the show today to discuss the villainous Shadar-Kai. These fiendish humanoids were introduced in the 1st Edition of the Fiend Folio in 1981 and have been twisted and changed over the years with each new creature tome issued, but have always held a dark allure, as doomed beings from the Shadowfell.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 12:14 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) – The Shadar-Kai 31:00 – Adam Bradford (@BadEyeAdam) and Todd Kenreck (@ToddKenreck) 1:11:03 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Molly Ostertag On Creative D&D Play
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) kick-off another exciting ride through a portal to the land of Dungeons & Dragons with the always radiant Shelly and an energized, coffee fueled Greg. Today they welcome the superbly talented artist and writer, Molly Ostertag (@mollyostertag). Born in the Hudson Valley area of upstate New York, Molly remembers the magical times she spent in the ancient forests around her home wearing elf ears whilst sharing in unforgettable stories with The Way Finder Experience; a live-action role-playing company for teens, children, and adults. Then she shares with us how she came to love story-telling which later led to writing and illustrating her own graphic novels. Her debut book The Witch Boy has garnered high praise for tackling challenging subjects such as gender identity in a fun and approachable way for children and adults alike. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@sernett) is on today to discuss the Saturday morning cartoon Dungeons & Dragons, which first debuted in 1983 and went for 3-seasons for a total of 27-episodes. Only 26-episodes were ever aired and rumor was that the last one revealed that in fact, all the kids had died and were in hell! Yes, a bit bleak for a Saturday morning kids show. But have no fear, Matt quickly dispels this rumor and sets the record straight drawing on his encyclopedic knowledge of D&D lore.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins:
00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 10:02 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) – The D&D Cartoon 31:07 – Molly Ostertag (@mollyostertag) 1:21:37 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Kat Kruger & Jen Vaughn On D20 Dames
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) begin as Greg fails his perception checks to discover this week's guests – Kat Kruger (@katkruger) and Jen Vaughn (@thejenya) from d20dames.com, a Bi-weekly D&D storytelling podcast. The Dames discuss how they each arrived in the realms of fantasy tabletop gaming. Misadventure awaits as Kat discusses a healthy obsession with penning original narratives as chief wordsmith at her company Steampunk Unicorn Studio, and Jen tells of her journey as a freelance cartoonist, game designer, and writer for comics such as Cartozia Tales and the new Goosebumps comic! Be sure to see D20 Dames live episode at this year's Emerald City Comic Con: Saturday, March 3rd, 2018. Lore You Should Know - Matt Sernett (@Sernett) focuses in on the wonderful world of Tieflings. These infernally spawned creatures have a long strange history in the realm since their introduction in 2nd Edition D&D.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 9:22 – Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) – Tieflings 32:28 – Kat Kruger (@katkruger) and Jen Vaughn (@thejenya) 1:21:10 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Inside D&D Adventurers League - Community
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) start off harmonizing a new frog and toad duet intro song before welcoming this week's guests – Alan Patrick (@warfteiner) and Lysa Chen (@mercyfuldm), community managers for the Dungeons & Dragons Adventurers League. After establishing that Lysa is gunning for Wolfgang Bauer's Dragon Talk record, we learn a bit more about Lysa and Alan's introduction to D&D, their work in the AL community, the community driven event “The Red War” and more! Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) talks all about the ins and outs of D&D canon including keeping and ditching canon when designing and developing, using and ignoring canon in your games, the secrets of White Paper Meetings and more!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 9:36– Lore You Should Know with Matt Sernett (@Sernett) – Lore Canon 32:28 – Alan Patrick (@warfteiner) and Lysa Chen (@mercyfuldm) 1:15:45 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Jeremy Crawford and Kate Irwin on Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) sit down with Kate Irwin and Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) to talk all about the upcoming Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes. After discussing the pros and cons of having more Kates in the office, Jeremy and Kate discuss updating the art design for the Tome's creatures, cosmic conflicts, monsters making their fifth edition debut, new player options and more! Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) gives us all the details on Mordenkainen, from his first days as Gary Gygax's character, to the formation of the Circle of Eight, to his most recent appearances in current D&D products and portrayal by Sam Witwer.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 13:10 – Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) – Mordenkainen 32:13 – Interview with Jeremy Crawford and Kate Irwin 1:21:45 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Hawke Robinson on RPG Research
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) kick off this week's podcast with a reveal of our new Avalon Hill game, “What is up with this house?!” and Shelly's super hero persona, The Interupter, before being joined by Hawke Robinson (@rpgresearch) and John Welker (@Saga_Welker) of RPG Research. After Hawke soothes us with his lovely radio voice, he and John share all the awesomeness of RPG Research including their work to show the beneficial qualities of roleplaying games, debunking older RPG stigmas, using RPGs for education and therapy, their traveling RPG trailer and more! Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) guides us through the intricacies of the Blood War, the ancient battle between the never-ending horde of demons and the devils who are selfishly safeguarding the planes.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 16:09 – Lore You Should Know with Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) – The Blood War 37:04 – Hawke Robinson (@rpgresearch) and John Welker (@Saga_Welker) 1:32:37 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Inside D&D Adventurers League - Content
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) are joined by Travis Woodall (@TravisWoodall) and Claire Hoffman (@DragonvuClaire) of the D&D Adventurers League. Claire and Travis talk to us about managing the creative side of D&D AL, guiding the adventures for each season, and a little of what the future holds. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) shares guidelines, tips and tricks for making your encounters and adventures more memorable and enjoyable.
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) 9:05 – Sage Advice with Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford)) – Encounters Building 51:36 – Travis Woodall (@TravisWoodall) and Claire Hoffman (@DragonvuClaire) 1:44:09 – Outro with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito

item.title: Joe Trier on How We Roll
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) are joined by Joe Trier (@HWRPodcast) and Eoghan (@HowWeRollEoghan) from the How We Roll podcast. Joe and Eoghan tell us about their journey from meeting on League of Legends to running through Curse of Strahd on their podcast, the other players and guests, and the sounds different dice make when rolling. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) explain the lawful but not always logical modrons including their famed Modron March, their home realm of Mechanus, what happens when a modron goes rogue and more!

item.title: Inside D&D Adventurers League
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Bill Benham (@BillBenham2) and Greg Marks (@Skerrit7h3green) of the Adventurers League join Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). After assigning classes to the cast of The Facts of Life and explaining Sausage Races, the crew jumps into the history of Adventurers League and Organized Play for D&D, how to play in and write for Adventurers League, turning our Community Manager Trevor Kidd (@The_Trevor_Kidd) into a troll, and more. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) regale us with the chaotic complexities of Slaadi, including how the origin stone came to reside in their home plane of Limbo, the importance of Slaadi control stones and their many choices when being confronted with cows. Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:

We talk about Ryan's (currently free) holiday adventure, Winter Flame, which you can find on Dungeon Masters Guild now, the fun holiday event Lysa is managing for Adventurers League and more! Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) go over the holidays and calendar in the Forgotten Realms. Happy Simril! We're taking a couple weeks off, but Dragon Talk will return in 2018!

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly's rock star Avalon Hill life has her pretty busy so Greg Tito (@gregtito) mixed things up by having two guests on at once in this episode of Dragon Talk. Wolfgang Baur (@monkeyking), head kobold of Kobold Press, and Meagan Maricle (@GMMoonwolf), editor extraordinaire, stop by Studio d20 to chat about their recent Kickstarter for the Creature Codex and the craft of editing and publishing RPG books. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) goes in depth on our side of the playtesting process, the fate of Unearthed Arcana features that didn't make it into Xanathar's Guide, what to expect from Unearthed Arcana in 2018 and more. Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:

Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) tell us all about the ins, outs and doughnutty ways of Sigil, the City of Doors, and it's enigmatic “leader” the Lady of Pain. After Shelly establishes that her potato leek soup tastes like vomit and old cheeseburgers, Alexandra talks about her progression from the D&D cartoon to DMing her first game, her tips for understanding the D&D lingo, her new podcast Dungeon Queering, and all her cool D&D conversations and projects! Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) clears up some confusion on the beguiling nature of illusions. He focuses on tips for using and DMing the use of illusions and encourages us to get creative when dealing with this school of magic. Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!

item.title: Xanathar's Lost Notes to Everything Else
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly is out performing Avalon Hill miracles, so Greg Tito is flying solo this week as he recovers from all the time travel he's done lately. James Haeck (@jamesjhaeck) and Ruty Rutenberg (@RutyWoot) call in to talk about the work they and their colleagues put in for flavorful and awesome Xanathar's Lost Notes to Everything Else – a companion to Xanathar's Guide to Everything designed by the Guild Adepts. After James shares his love for world-ending dragons, we get into his and Ruty's favorite new subclasses from Xanathar's Notes, with the Discord Bard and the Runegaurd Fighter topping the list. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) return to the topic of Wyrms of the North, this time focusing on the good metallic dragons, such as the Felgalus, the flying misfortune, so named for his unfortunate habit of “accidentally” flying into unexpecting bystanders, and Palarandusk, the Unseen Protector, featured in Force Grey by Matt Mercer and named for the fact that's parts of his body phase in and out of! Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!
Here's a guide to when each segment on the podcast begins: 00:00 – Intro with and Greg Tito (@gregtito) and James Haeck (@jamesjhaeck) 02:22 – Lore You Should Know - Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) – Good Wyrms of the North 47:34 – Interview with James Haeck (@jamesjhaeck) and Ruty Rutenberg (@RutyWoot) 1:38:32 – Outro with Greg Tito

Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) talk about all the proliferation of evil trees in Dungeons & Dragons, such as the stump and bunny growth of the Wolf in Sheep's Clothing, the odd creatures spawned from the Orcwort tree, the pod-people spawned by the Doppelganger plant and more! Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!

Graeme recounts how his first D&D character was promptly thrown in jail after failing a pickpocket roll, suggested a few ways the Forgotten Realms could be changed to support more characters of color, advised us all go to Bali for D&D research and more. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) detail some of the most notorious wyrms (aka chromatic dragons) of the Forgotten Realms, including a dragon with a dead wizard strapped to its back, crafty black dragon twins, and a dragon that raises his own cattle. item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary:
Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) open up this week's Dragon Talk podcast with a musical number before calling Kevin Wilson (@KevinWilson42), designer of the Tomb of Annihilation adventure system board game. Kevin shares the story of how his campaign world for Isles of Treachery got him started in game design, adapting the Tomb of Annihilation adventure to a board game, and our favorite bad guy, Bob Acererak. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) takes us on a magical journey through the astral plane where we learn about psychic winds, color pools, and why we should be avoiding astral dreadnoughts. Greg and Shelly also let us in on how the word “fool” is being used by kids today. Lore You Should Know - Matt Sernett (@Sernett) discloses all Mystra's secrets as we dive into the history and mysteries of The Weave!

Frederic Tremblay from BKOM calls in to talk about Tales from Candlekeep: Tomb of Annihilation, including converting the board game to a digital game and some basic strategies for tackling monsters and traps. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) takes us all the way back to chainmail as we talk about the origins of Lycanthropes, their evolution through the editions of D&D, and how you might be able to tie them into your own campaigns. Watch Dragon Talk recordings live on twitch.tv/dnd Mondays at 2pm PT!

item.itunes:summary:
Josh Perault (@XiroxisTheBeard) and Jon “Bucky” Buckmaster (@bucky_masters) from the Taking Initiative podcast call in from the far away demiplane of New York city to talk to Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). We learn about Josh and Bucky growing up together playing D&D, why Bucky can't ever play Josh's character, the harsh D&D judgement of Josh's dad, and the creation of the Podcasts of Annihilation. Sage Advice - Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) gives all the details on conditions, including what condition almost every character experiences every session, the differences between grappled and restrained, and the importance of concise rules text. Joe Della Bella, Dungeon Master for the live D&D play podcast You Meet in a Tavern calls in to Bart Carroll (@bart_carroll) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). Joe tells us about how quickly his first character (a rogue) died, about his group's adventure in Chult, and how awesome it is to have magical potions replaced with magical beer. Lore You Should Know - Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) tell us all about Sahuagin, including why we might be pronouncing it wrong, their odd history with the sea elves and the fact that they are most definitely not shark people. item.title: Will Jones & Syd Shields on Encounter Roleplay

The delightful pair that's a big part of Encounter Roleplay, Will Jones (@encounterRP) and Sydney Shields (@sydshields), calls in to Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) to talk about their new show on the D&D Twitch channel, Learn to Play, their involvement in Podcasts of Annihilation and how they approach roleplaying. item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Breaking into freelance D&D writing is tough, but James Haeck (@jamesjhaeck) joins us to tell us how his talents were discovered with a little help from a Critical Role. Greg Tito (@gregtito) is joined by co-host Bart Carroll (@bart_carroll) to chat about superheroes and kids puking. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford speaks about stealth, but you need to roll Wisdom (Perception) check to determine if you can hear him.

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons

Hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) talk briefly about headphones, which are called "cans" in the audio business, I swear. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDND) talk about the funny, wondrous creatures called Flumphs.

item.title: Mike Mearls on Tales from the Yawning Portal

Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) goes into the story behind two deities in D&D - Lathander and Amauntaur. Thanks to @jimdabison for the topic suggestion!

item.title: Chris Avellone and Philip Daigle on Planescape: Torment Enhanced Edition

Hosts Trevor Kidd (@the_trevor_kidd) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) struggle through Greg's sickness to keep the energy up! Sage Advice - Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) discusses at length the complexities of the Druid class feature Wild Shape.

item.title: Justin Ziran and Kate Irwin on WizKids Miniatures

Hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) try not to talk about The Bachelor. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) explores the area of Chult in the Forgotten Realms. Thanks to @VeritableTwenty for the topic suggestion!

item.title: Dylan Sprouse on PUG Crawl
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons

Hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) talk about snow again, before Greg gets the date of Meltdown Shopping Network debut on Mar 24 consistently wrong in this recording – sorry Gaston! Check it out on Twitch.tv/wotc_dnd Mar. 24 starting at 4pm PT! Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) talks about the multitude of entities in D&D lore from which a warlock can draw power. Thanks to @monkib0y for the topic suggestion!

item.title: Experiment 7 on Dungeon Chess
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Geoffrey Zatkin (@geoffreyzatkin) and Demetri Detsaridis (@detsaridis) from Experiment 7 call in from GDC to unload their D&D-cred on us and the possibilities of VR starting with Dungeon Chess! Hosts Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) do some time-traveling talk of snow. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) talks about the fun of the Moonshae Isles, an archipelago full of interesting and sometimes contrasting cultures. Thanks to @VeritableTwenty for the topic suggestion!

item.title: Jerry Holkins on Acquisitions Inc. C Team
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Jerry Holkins from Penny Arcade calls in to speak effusively about his Acquisitions Inc. C Team stream, what he's doing during PAX East, and blacking out on stage with a loopy Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) goes into depth on White Plume Mountain, one of the adventures from Tales from the Yawning Portal.

item.title: John Darnielle from the Mountain Goats on Storytelling
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Bart Carroll (@bart_carroll) and Trevor Kidd (@the_trevor_kidd) take over hosting duties as John Darnielle, leader of the folk-rock group The Mountain Goats (@mountain_goats), dropped by the office to chat about his new novel Universal Harvester, his music and how D&D is a throughline. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) speaks with missing host Greg Tito on the Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan.

item.title: Thomas Foss on Neverwinter: The Cloaked Ascendancy
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The veteran game designer from Cryptic Studios, Thomas Foss, rejoins the podcast to discuss the next module coming to Neverwinter based on four mages returning to the city. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDND) go into the first series of adventure modules published by TSR, collectively called Against the Giants.

item.title: Tanya DePass on Creating D&D Characters
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Tanya DePass (@cypheroftyr) has played D&D for years and she brings her experience in talking about diversity in gaming to creating D&D characters and her shared love of Dragon Age 2 with Greg Tito. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@Sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDND) discuss the iconic Tomb of Horrors adventure in Tales from the Yawning Portal. Plus, guest host Bart Carroll joins the podcast to talk about Dragon+.

item.title: Joe Manganiello on Acting D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: You may know Joe Manganiello (@JoeManganiello) from True Blood and the Magic Mike films, and he'll be playing Deathstroke in the next Batman movie. In talking to Greg Tito (@gregtito) and Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo), Joe geeks out about all things D&D, fantasy, and comics. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) goes over reaction timing in initiative order.

item.title: Matt Colville on How to DM
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Video game and fantasy writer Matt Colville (@mattcolville) talks with us about getting into Dungeon Mastering, which he expounds upon in his YouTube videos. Sage Advice – Jeremy Crawford (@JeremyECrawford) discusses temporary hit points and some the design and confusion about it.

item.title: Adam Koebel and JP McDaniel on Streaming D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Two early adopters of streaming live D&D play online, J.P. McDaniel (@itmejp) and Adam Koebel (@skinnyghost) call in to chat with us about their inspiration. In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett go into detail on the recent happenings in the Forgotten Realms.

item.title: Wolfgang Baur on DMing for Girl Scouts
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Kobold in Chief Wolfgang Baur visits the show to check in with us, talk about his recent DMing for Girl Scouts and what's coming down the pipe in 2017 for Kobold Press. In Sage Advice, Jeremy Crawford wades into the mire of spell targeting and clears away the muck to provide clarity.

item.title: Luke Gygax on GaryCon
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The son of D&D co-creator Gary Gygax calls in to talk with about his father's legacy and the upcoming GaryCon he runs in Lake Geneva, Wisconsin. In Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins talk more about Blackstaff and what that means in the Forgotten Realms.

item.title: Monica Valentinelli on D&D Adventures
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito speak to Monica Valentinelli, a prolific creative writer with heavy involvement in all forms of D&D from adventure writing to running and playing games with new players. In Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins jump into the Yawning Portal.

item.title: Jeff Greiner on The Tome Show
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito talk with an old friend of Dragon Talk, Mr. Jeff Greiner from second longest running D&D podcast: The Tome Show! In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett go over holidays and the calendar in the Forgotten Realms. Happy Holidays! We're taking a few weeks off but Dragon Talk will return in 2017!

item.title: David Eddings on Roleplaying Claptrap
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Special guest David Eddings from Gearbox Software calls in and talks (a lot) about how he got way into D&D late in life, how he recorded the voice of an iconic character from Borderlands, and how he spoke about his cousin the fantasy author with George R. R. Martin. Before that, Lore You Should Know jumps into a pivotal moment in the Forgotten Realms with Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins – the Sundering!

item.title: Reid and Kelsey on Sneak Attack podcast
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: We hear from some of the folks (DM Reid and Kelsey who plays Brenna) behind the awesome Sneak Attack Podcast, a live play but slightly edited D&D audio adventure. The return of Lore You Should Know! – Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins join Greg Tito to discuss the positive and negative planes in D&D cosmology.

item.title: David Reid on MetaArcade
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: D&D is all about creativity and David Reid from MetaArcade (@pokethulhu) talks about a product he's bringing to mobile and PC to help burgeoning D&D players write their own simple adventures for their friends to enjoy. Sage Advice - Jeremy Crawford (@jeremyecrawford) sheds some light on how the Lucky feat interacts with advantage and disadvantage rolls.

item.title: Jon Peterson on the Lost D&D Radio Show
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: On this special Thanksgiving Day episode, we are proud to present a previously unknown part of D&D history – a pilot for a D&D radio show created in 1982 by TSR. Archivist Jon Peterson uncovered this recording and allowed us to present it in full, with plenty of commentary from Greg Tito and Shelly Mazzanoble.

item.title: Satine Phoenix and Ruty Rutenberg on Maze Arcana
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Our friends from L.A., Satine Phoenix and Ruty Rutenberg call in to talk about starting a D&D live stream, playing Eberron in fifth edition and where to get good elf ears, not necessarily in order. We also introduce a new segment called Sage Advice with Jeremy Crawford, lead rules developer for D&D, to clarify rules that affect Armor Class like barkskin and cover.

item.title: Matt Forbeck on Dungeonology
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Veteran author, Matt Forbeck, calls in to chat about his long history with D&D and what you can find in Dungeonology, an introduction to adventuring in the Forgotten Realms. Lore You Should Know – Goblins are crazy little jerks, but Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins talk about they sometimes work together with hobgoblins and bugbears.

item.title: Jeremy Crawford & Emi Tanji on Volo's Guide to Monsters
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The D&D team has honed the process of making books like Volo's Guide to Monsters down to a science and Jeremy Crawford and Emi Tanji are a big part of the reason why. Greg Tito and Shelly Mazzanoble get them to open up about what you can find in that book in this episode's interview. Lore You Should Know – Orcs are pretty cool in Volo's Guide to Monsters, says Matt Sernett and Chris Perkins.

item.title: Ben Kweller on Rocking D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Rock musician Ben Kweller has been a fan of D&D for a long time and we spoke with him about what it's like to play with his crew while on tour, and getting his kids into the game. Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins explains what makes gnolls special in Volo's Guide to Monsters.

item.title: R.A. Salvatore on Hero
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The author of the Legend of Drizzt Do'Urden finishes up the Homecoming series with Hero due out on October 25th, and R.A. Salvatore calls in to speak with Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) about the book. Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins dishes about one of his favorite enemies appearing in Volo's Guide to Monsters, the yuan-ti. (No, thank you.)

item.title: Keith Baker and the Decemberists Join Forces
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The Decemberists are big fans of gaming and D&D, and they asked Keith Baker (@HellcowKeith) of Eberron fame to design a game based on their album, The Hazards of Love. Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) asked guitarist Chris Funk (@MRCHRISFUNK) about that process and how the band unwinds playing games on the road. Chris Perkins gives some insight on Mindflayers in Lore You Should Know.

item.title: Erin M. Evans on The Devil You Know
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Erin M. Evans (@erinmevans) calls Trevor Kidd (@the_trevor_kidd) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) to chat about what it's like writing the conclusion to the Brimstone Angels saga. Chris Perkins goes over the Shadwfell in Lore You Should Know.

item.title: Wolfgang Baur on Tome of Beasts
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Kobold-in-Chief Wolfgang Baur (@monkeyking) drops by the D&D offices again to show off a copy of Tome of Beasts from Kobold Press to Shelly (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito). Lore You Should Know – Chris and Matt discuss the relationship between Volo and Elminster.

item.title: Dungeon Mastering Birthday Parties
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Shelly Mazzanoble (@shellymoo) and Greg Tito (@gregtito) speak with a special guest Ben Cameron on his experiences running D&D for kids' events, as well as games for adults, all within the same shard universe created by his crazy imagination. Lore You Should Know – Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnd) and Matt Sernett (@sernett) discuss the Feywild!

item.title: Liam O'Brien and Laura Bailey on Critical Role
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Recorded June 2016. Two of the cast members of Critical Role come on to chat about what it's like playing twin characters for more than three years, while in Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett jump into discussing an elusive group in the Forgotten Realms called the Kraken Society.

item.title: Funhaus on Twits and Crits
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: A new D&D show emerges from FunHaus in L.A., and we speak to Dungeon Master Dan Schneider and player Elyse Willems about the crazy shenanigans on Twits & Crits. In LYSK, we delve into the final faction, the Emerald Enclave, and talk about what a new group is doing during Storm King's Thunder.

item.title: Chris Perkins on Storm King's Thunder
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito pick Chris Perkins' brain about how he writes such epic adventures like Storm King's Thunder, and what to expect in the book that will be available everywhere on September 6th. Lore You Should Know - Matt and Chris move on from last week's segment to discuss Waterdeep, City of Splendors.

item.title: Thomas Foss on Neverwinter: Storm King's Thunder
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The latest module for Neverwinter is out and it's a doozie. Thomas Foss, the new (old) lead designer of Neverwinter comes on Dragon Talk to talk about the three new zones, characters you'll meet and playing Chainmail in 80s. An apt Lore You Should Know segment has Perkins and Sernett discussing the history of the city of Neverwinter.

item.title: RPG Academy on D&D Podcasts
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Caleb Gillombardo and Michael Ross from the RPG Academy podcast stop in to talk about Michael's Gen Con experience and their D&D origin stories. Lore You Should Know - Matt and Chris delve into the Zhentarim and the Order of the Gauntlet factions and what they are doing with Storm King's Thunder.

item.title: Scott Kurtz on D&D at PAX
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Binwin Bronzebottom himself, Scott Kurtz of PVP and Acquisitions Incorporated fame, calls in to Dragon Talk to chat about what's happening at PAX West 2016 with Acquisitions Incorporated appearing in movie theaters across the U.S on September 4th. Check out Fathom.com to buy tickets! Lore You Should Know - Matt and Chris discuss the Harpers and the Lords Alliance factions in Storm King's Thunder.

item.title: Documenting Dwarven Forge
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Stefan Pokorny, founder and chief sculptor of Dwarven Forge miniature scenery, calls in from Brooklyn along with the director of a new documentary, Josh Bishop. Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito discuss Stefan's love of D&D and what it was like to work with Josh to create documentary, The Dwarvenaut. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) tell us all about stone and hill giants.

item.title: Ethan Gilsdorf on Why D&D Is Good for You
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Friend of the show, Ethan Gilsdorf, drops in to chat about his recent TEDx talk that shows the good that D&D can do for kids and adults. Lore You Should Know – Matt Sernett (@sernett) and Chris Perkins (@ChrisPerkinsDnD) elaborate on a magic item with a long history in D&D, the Ring of Winter.

item.title: Orion Acaba on Draconian Knights
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Taking his character from Critical Role and previous gameplay, Orion Acaba talks about creating an audio narrative series called Draconian Knights centered around a family of dragonborn heroes. Lore You Should Know - Matt and Chris stop by to elucidate on what makes frost and fire giants unique.

item.title: Chris Cocks, President of Wizards of the Coast
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The new head of Wizards of the Coast, Chris Cocks, comes to talk to Greg Tito and Shelly Mazzanoble about his gaming history and where he thinks D&D will go from here. In Lore You Should Know, Chris Perkins and Matt Sernett jump into discussing the lore behind storm giants and their closest brethren in the ordning, the cloud giants.

item.title: Ed Greenwood on Death Masks & Forgotten Realms
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Ed Greenwood, Father of the Realms, graces us with his presence to discuss his newest novel, Death Masks, and why it's important to limit the powers of Elminster when you're telling a murder mystery. Before that, Lore You Should Know discusses the giant gods and their role in Storm King's Thunder.

item.title: Peter Lee and Andrew Veen on Tyrants of the Underdark
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: After we learn about the background of Force Grey from Adam Lee and Matt Sernett in a new segment called Lore You Should Know, Greg Tito delves deep into the design and development of the new board game, Tyrants of the Underdark, published by Gale Force 9 and designed by Peter Lee, Rodney Thompson, and Andrew Veen.

item.title: Longest D&D Campaign Ever?
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: We speak to a very special Dungeon Master, Robert Warbaugh, about his D&D campaign that's been running 2 sessions per week for 34 years. Jason Hashimoto provides the player's perspective to Warbaugh's campaign.

item.title: Geekly Inc on Drunks and Dragons
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Tim Lanning and Micheal DiMauro from Dragons & Drunks call in to talk about their liveplay podcast that's super strong on story and silliness.

item.title: John August and Craig Mazin on D&D Scriptwriting Tips
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Screenwriters John August (Big Fish) and Craig Mazin (The Hangover Part II) from the Script Notes podcast come on to talk about their D&D group full of film and TV writers.

item.title: Nathan Stewart on What's Up at Meltdown
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: D&D Brand Director Nathan Stewart gives the inside scoop on what's up at Meltdown in the upcoming D&D Live from Meltdown event, in which we'll be announcing the newest D&D story and product line-up.

item.title: Mike Selinker on Betraying D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Another D&D alum, Mike Selinker, stops by to chat about his work on D&D third edition, the Betrayal at House on the Hill board game, and, more recently, the first expansion to Betrayal called Widow's Walk.

item.title: Wolfgang Baur on Kobold Press
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Wolfgang Baur returns to tell us some more crazy stories, sing some Hall & Oates, and talk about what Kobold Press is putting up on the DMs Guild.

item.title: Dr. Raffael Boccamazzo on D&D and Autism
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Psychotherapist Dr. Raffael Boccamazzo visits the office to talk about using Dungeons & Dragons to help autistic kids learn social skills.

item.title: High Rollers on Streaming D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Yogcast folks Mark Hulmes and Kim Richards call in from across the pond in England to talk about playing their new but popular stream High Rollers.

item.title: Saladin Ahmed on D&D Inspired Novels
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Author Saladin Ahmed stops by to talk about how Dungeons & Dragons inspired his 2011 novel Throne of the Crescent Moon and what it's like playing with him at conventions.

item.title: Feel Train on Madame Eva and Twitter Bots
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Darius Kazemi and Courtney Stanton of Feel Train come on to talk about the Madame Eva Twitter bot, how bots might be used in D&D going forward and what the heck a "bot" is anyway.

item.title: Misscliks Cofounders on D&D Entertainment
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Anna Prosser Robinson and Stephanie Powell, two of the cofounders of online gaming outfit Misscliks, call in to chat with us about coming to D&D late in life and their new projects.

item.title: Otikor & Timmons from Misscliks
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Dungeon Masters Nadja Otikor and Jess Timmons from the Misscliks talk about what it's like to come to D&D late in life and play for a video streaming audience.

item.title: Lauren (OboeCrazy) Urban on D&D&Drunks
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Lauren Urban came to the WOTC offices to talk with Shelly and Greg about what it's like to Dungeon Master for the Dungeons & Dragons & Drunks portion of the Glibshark podcast. We giggled a lot.

item.title: Jim Zub on D&D Comic Books
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Comic book writer Jim Zub (Marvel, IDW, Image) joins us to talk about his new Dungeons & Dragons comic from IDW taking the characters from Legends of Baldur's Gate into Strahd's realm.

item.title: Rob Overmeyer on Neverwinter The Maze Engine
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Executive Producer of Neverwinter, Rob Overmeyer calls in from Cryptic Studios to give us the lowdown on the upcoming expansion, The Maze Engine.

item.title: D&D and Theater Collide in "She Kills Monsters"
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The play "She Kills Monsters" by Qui Nguyen is a weird combination of madcap comedy and heartbreaking coming-of-age drama all told inside a D&D module from the 90s. We talk to Lance Gharavi and Antoinette Martin-Hanson, the director and star of a new production at Arizona State University.

item.title: Kurtis Wiebe & Shannon Woodhouse on Rat Queens & D20 Babe
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Husband and wife Kurtis Wiebe (writer of the comic Rat Queens) and Shannon Woodhouse (D20 Babe) split the party to talk about their livestream and the inspiration behind Rat Queens.

item.title: Wolfgang Baur on the Dungeon Masters Guild
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Wolfgang Baur, Kobold-in-Chief of Kobold Press, drops by the podcast to talk about his (long) history with Dungeons & Dragons, the success of the Dungeon Masters Guild and possibly rejecting Chris Perkins' first submission to Dragon Magazine in the 90s.

item.title: Live Play D&D with Godsfall DM Aram Vartian
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The DM of Godsfall Aram Vartian and puckish rogue Doug Horne join us to talk about the inspiration behind the world and how long it takes to carefully edit each episode.

item.title: The Art of Dungeons & Dragons and Curse of Strahd
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Creative Director Shauna Narciso and Art Director Kate Irwin share insights on the visual look of D&D and the Curse of Strahd adventure.

item.title: Mike Drucker on Playing D&D with Comedians
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: RECORDED NOV. 2015. Gamer, Comedian and Writer for The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Mike Drucker has a pretty impressive resume. Hosts Trevor Kidd, Shelly Mazzanoble, and Greg Tito talk to Mike about his experience with Dungeons & Dragons, dealing with that one jerk in the party, and why he plays the most devout of clerics.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Drucker on Playing D&D with Comedians

item.title: Chris Perkins and Tracy Hickman on Curse of Strahd
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Gaming minds collide when Chris Perkins and Tracy Hickman talk about the return to Ravenloft in D&D's latest adventure, Curse of Strahd.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Perkins and Tracy Hickman on Curse of Strahd

item.title: Dungeon Masters Guild
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The Dungeon Masters Guild is live! Mike Mearls and Chris Lindsay from the D&D team talk about what it was like to bring this new marketplace for D&D material to life and why we opened up the Forgotten Realms.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dungeon Masters Guild

item.title: Enter the Adventure Zone
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Dungeon Master for The Adventure Zone podcast, Grifin McElroy, shares his D&D origin story, and professes his love of fifth edition.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enter the Adventure Zone

item.title: Erin M. Evans on Her Latest D&D Novel
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Erin M. Evans, author of the Brimstone Angels saga, drops in to talk about her upcoming book, Ashes of the Tyrant, with hosts Greg Tito and Shelly Mazzanoble.
item.itunes:subtitle: Erin M. Evans on Her Latest D&D Novel

item.title: The Holidays with Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Tara Theoharis, also know as the GeekyHostess.com, takes a break from hanging out during the awesome Desert Bus fundraiser to chat with Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito about great ways to entertain your gaming friends and family during the holiday season.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Holidays with Dungeons & Dragons

item.title: Rainn Wilson on Growing Up Geeky
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Rainn Wilson, who you may know as Dwight Schrute from The Office, speaks to hosts Shelly Mazzanoble and Greg Tito about his new autobiography, The Bassoon King.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rainn Wilson on Growing Up Geeky

item.title: Neverwinter: Demogorgon is in the House
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Hosts Trevor Kidd and Greg Tito get on the horn with Rob Overmeyer, Executive Producer of Neverwinter at Cryptic Studios, to dish about what's happening in the Underdark.

item.title: Late Late Show Writer Jared Logan on Dungeon Mastering
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Our intrepid hosts Greg Tito and Trevor Kidd pick the brain of stand-up comedian and TV writer, Jared Logan.

item.title: Sword Coast Legends Launch Day
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Hosts Greg Tito and Trevor Kidd speak to two of the awesome folks behind Sword Coast Legends, community manager Ash Seville and Ross Gardner, Technical Director.

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Matthew Mercer, Marisha Ray, and Orion Acaba from Geek & Sundry's Critical Role call in to chat with hosts Greg Tito and Shelly Mazzanoble.

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Learn how a Texas high school teacher is changing education through the power of D&D!

item.itunes:summary: Canadian rocker Matthew Good has a new album coming out titled Chaotic Neutral. That piqued our interest, so we invited him on the show to talk D&D, music, and more.

item.itunes:summary: In today's D&D podcast we talk to R.A. Salvatore and the Green Ronin team behind Out of the Abyss.

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: PAX Prime is right around the corner and we're interrupting everyone's frantic planning to chat about the highlights!

item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: A look at the challenges of fantasy writing, and then how you can get involved in this year's D&D Extra Life charity event.

item.itunes:summary: A look at the game, including the latest psionics rules, and advice for running D&D sessions with kids!

item.itunes:summary: After an overdue introduction of D&D's Greg Tito, we revisit the Neverwinter MMO and discuss the coming Strongholds expansion.
