item.title: Virtual Tables and Board Games
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: We talk with Doug Davison from Fantasy Grounds, and then a visit from R&D Game Designers Chris Dupuis and Ben Petrisor.
item.itunes:subtitle: Virtual Tables and Board Games

item.title: Adventure Time: Elemental Evil
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: We talk to veteran game designer Rich Baker about Princes of the Apocalypse. And then, a visit with Adventure Time's Pendleton Ward!
item.itunes:subtitle: Adventure Time: Elemental Evil

item.title: Organized Play and Elemental Evil
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Chris Tulach and Chris Lindsay, from the OP and Brand teams, discuss the latest events taking place in the D&D Adventurer's League!
item.itunes:subtitle: OP Elemental Evil

item.title: Events in the Forgotten Realms
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In our latest episode, we speak with acclaimed fantasy author R.A. Salvatore, as well as n-Space's Dan Tudge!
item.itunes:subtitle: Events in the Forgotten Realms

item.title: Dungeon Masters Appreciated: Part 3
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In our latest episode, we speak with Dungeon Masters from both the Adventurer's League and Harmontown.
item.itunes:subtitle: DMs Appreciated: Part 3

item.title: Dungeon Masters Appreciated: Part 2
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In our latest episode we discuss world-building, campaign creation, and adventure writing!
item.itunes:subtitle: DMs Appreciated: Part 2

item.title: Dungeon Masters Appreciated: Part 1
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In our latest episode we speak with not one, not two, but three esteemed Dungeon Masters.
item.itunes:subtitle: DMs Appreciated: Part 1

item.title: D&D for the Holidays
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In our latest episode we speak to two esteemed guests: Geeky Hostess and Dungeon Bastard!
item.itunes:subtitle: D&D for the Holidays

item.title: Rise of Tiamat
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Rob Overmeyer of Cryptic Studios returns to discuss the Rise of Tiamat in the Neverwinter MMO!
item.itunes:subtitle: Rise of Tiamat

item.title: Dungeon Master's Guide Design
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Hosts Bart Carroll and Shelly Mazzanoble delve into the pages of the Dungeon Master's Guide, along with R&D's Mike Mearls!
item.itunes:subtitle: Dungeon Master's Guide Design

item.title: Monster Manual Design
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, hosts Bart Carroll and Shelly Mazzanoble crack open the recently released Monster Manual and dare to peek inside.
item.itunes:subtitle: Monster Manual Design

item.title: Fifth Edition and D&D Organized Play
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Chris Tulach joins the podcast to discuss 5e D&D Organized Play and the Adventurers League.
item.itunes:subtitle: Organized Play

item.title: Author and the Modelmaker
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Author David Ewalt discusses his book, Of Dice and Men, now in paperback. Then, Mat Smith covers the stunning models he created for the PAX Prime D&D Live Games.
item.itunes:subtitle: Author and the Modelmaker

item.title: Artists and Authors
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Tyler Jacobson discusses the cover art for the fifth edition core rulebooks. And then, R.A. Salvatore and Troy Denning join the conversation about the end of The Sundering and the start of the Tyranny of Dragons!
item.itunes:subtitle: Artists and Authors

item.title: The Herald
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: James Wyatt sits down with Ed Greenwood to discuss the final book in The Sundering series, The Herald, and where things might lead from there!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Herald

item.title: Tyranny of Dragons
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: We first sit down with R&D to discuss the announcement of Tyranny of Dragons, as well as the products and programs in support of this campaign. In our next segment, Trevor Kidd interviews Rob Overmeyer about the Neverwinter MMO!
item.itunes:subtitle: Tyranny of Dragons

item.title: Dan Harmon
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: The D&D podcast returns for a very special interview. This episode's guest happens to be the creative mind behind NBC's Community - none other than Dan Harmon himself!
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan Harmon Interview

item.title: D&D Next Playtest
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike, Jeremy, and Rodney sit down to discuss the playtest packet that recently went live, including changes to the paladin, druid, rogue, and barbarian. Plus, find out about future playtesting endeavors, the livestream games, and Lords of Waterdeep coming to a tablet near you!
item.itunes:subtitle: The D&D Next Playtest

item.title: Against the Slave Lords (Part 3)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike and Rodney look back at the third and final session of A1 Slave Pits of the Undercity. Mike used miniatures and D&D Dungeon tiles to build a set-piece encounter for this last session and Mike and Rodney talk about how this affected the play, and how DMs could integrate this and other styles intor their game. They also touch on one hour rests, renewable character resources, and plans for the next live stream.
item.itunes:subtitle: Against the Slave Lords Session 3

item.title: Against the Slave Lords (Part 2)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike and Rodney look back at the second session of the D&D Next livestream game of A1 Slave Pits of the Undercity. We discuss the highlights of the session, including the final explosive fight, and take a look at the kinds of things a DM can do to enhance the experience for everyone at the table.
item.itunes:subtitle: Against the Slave Lords Session 2

item.title: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Rodney sits down with Chris Dupuis and Peter Lee to talk board games, specifically the forthcoming expansion to Lords of Waterdeep. Scoundrels of Skullport releases August 20th and the crew looks back at the design of its two game modules: Undermountain and Skullport.
item.itunes:subtitle: Scoundrels of Skullport

item.title: Against the Slave Lords (Part 1)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike Mearls looks back at the recent D&D Next livestream game of A1 Slave Pits of Undercity. Mike and Rodney discuss the results of the session, especially as it pertained to the deadly fight against the ghouls.
item.itunes:subtitle: Against the Slave Lords Session 1

item.title: Kim Mohan
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, WotC bids a fond farewell to longstanding editor and former Dragon Magazine editor-in-chief, Kim Mohan. With Kim's retirement upon us, we wanted to entreat him for tales of starting up in the industry, the major shifts he's seen in magazine publishing, and his thoughts on the future of the game!

item.title: 2nd Edition D&D
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we look back at the creation of 2nd Edition Advanced D&D - and who better to enlighten us than R&D's Steve Winter! We ask Steve to share his stories behind 2e's development, including what classes were selected, the philosophy of campaign settings, and the ankheg's mysterious name change.
item.itunes:subtitle: 2nd Edition D&D

item.title: The Fine Art of the DM
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this bonus episode surrounding the Mines of Madness, we bring in Chris Perkins to discuss the creation of this adventure and its debut at PAX East. Plus, as the DM Experience column has drawn to a close, we ask Chris about his home campaigns, his advice for fellow DMs, and what he's looking forward to in D&D Next.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Fine Art of the DM

item.title: D&D Next Playtest (New Classes)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Mike sits down with R&D's Mike Mearls and Rodney Thompson to discuss the forthcoming D&D Next playtest packet. Mike and Rodney go through the changes and additions to expect, discuss the philosophy behind such mechanics as the ranger's favored enemy, and Mike reveals a dangerous secret about his in-game character.
item.itunes:subtitle: D&D Next Playtest (New Classes)

item.title: Blood of Gruumsh
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Mike sists down with Chris Dupuis and Rodney Thompson to talk Dungeon Command: Blood of Gruumsh, Unearthed Arcana, and the Original "White Box" Edition of the game. From there, Mike and Rodney move on to discuss the current status of D&D Next, including possible roles and implementation for party leaders.
item.itunes:subtitle: Blood of Gruumsh

item.title: Felicia Day
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: It's Emerald City Comicon - and none other than Felicai Day stopped by our studio to talk D&D, Geek & Sundry, and National TableTop Day!
item.itunes:subtitle: Felicia Day

item.title: D&D Next Playtest, Barbarian
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, host Mike Robels sits down with Mike Mearls, Jeremy Crawford, and Rodney Thompson to discuss the news surrounding the latest D&D Next playtest, including this packet's barbarian. Plus, what to look forward to in future packets - and a debate on the greatest barbarian of all time!
item.itunes:subtitle: News surrounding the latest D&D Next playtest, including this packet's barbarian.

item.title: D&D Next Playtest, Curse of Undeath
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, host Mike Robels sits down with Jeremy Crawford and Rodney Thompson to discuss the D&D Next playtest, including the current packet's classes and the Isle of Dread. Then, Rodney and Peter Lee run through the latest Dungeon Command faction pack: Curse of Undeath!
item.itunes:subtitle: More on the D&D Next Playtest, plus Curse of Undeath!

item.title: Acquisitions Incorporated - Live Q&A with Mike Mearls (Part 4)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike Mearls, Senior Manager of D&D R&D at WOTC, sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP. In this podcast, he helps educate them on character creation and conversion - gearing up for the Live D&D game taking place at this year's PAX (Part 4)!
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Mearls sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP (Part 4)!

item.title: Acquisitions Incorporated - Live Q&A with Mike Mearls (Part 3)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike Mearls, Senior Manager of D&D R&D at WOTC, sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP. In this podcast, he helps educate them on character creation and conversion - gearing up for the Live D&D game taking place at this year's PAX (Part 3)!
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Mearls sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP (Part 3)!

item.title: Acquisitions Incorporated - Live Q&A with Mike Mearls (Part 2)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike Mearls, Senior Manager of D&D R&D at WOTC, sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP. In this podcast, he helps educate them on character creation and conversion - gearing up for the Live D&D game taking place at this year's PAX (Part 2)!

item.title: Acquisitions Incorporated - Live Q&A with Mike Mearls (Part 1)
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: Mike Mearls, Senior Manager of D&D R&D at WOTC, sits down with the folks at Penny Arcade and PvP. In this podcast, he helps educate them on character creation and conversion - gearing up for the Live D&D game taking place at this year's PAX (Part 1)!

item.title: D&D Next Playtest, Dungeon Command
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, host Mike Robels asks R&D's Mike Mearls and Jeremy Crawford about the ongoing D&D Next playtest, including what to look forward to at Gen Con 2012. Then Rodney Thompson, Peter Lee, and Chris Dupuis join the podcast to discuss the creation and development of Dungeon Command!
item.itunes:subtitle: More on the D&D Next Playtest, plus the release of Dungeon Command!

item.title: D&D Next Playtest Opens
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the D&D podcast, Mike Robles in on hand to discuss the D&D Next playtest with R&D's Mike Mearls and Jeremy Crawford.

item.title: D&D Next, Lords of Waterdeep
item.itunes:author: Dungeons & Dragons
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of the D&D podcast, Mike Robles is on hand to discuss the D&D Next playtest with R&D's Mike Mearls and Jeremy Crawford - including questions you asked via Twitter. Then, we talk to Rodney Thompson about the latest D&D board game: Lords of Waterdeep.
